World Nuclear Newshttps://www.world-nuclear-news.org/?rss=feedWorld Nuclear News recent storiesen-GB 21e85471-9319-4c9a-93db-cd237c6f76dd US takes steps to jump start overseas SMR deploymentsThe US Department of State and US Export-Import Bank has announced a suite of financial tools to support the deployment of advanced nuclear energy systems to help reach net-zero goals. It also announced plans to mobilise more than USD4.2 billion of investment in enrichment and conversion capacity through the five-nation Sapporo 5 collaboration.

Wed, 06 Dec 2023 15:43:53 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/enCore-and-Boss-Energy-form-strategic-partnership?feed=feed 891171f5-e0e3-4cf6-96e4-f61a1c9a7a3d TRIGA International to produce fuel for US microreactorTRIGA International - a joint venture between Framatome and General Atomics - has been awarded a contract to fabricate TRIGA-like fuel for the US Department of Energy's Microreactor Applications Research Validation and Evaluation microreactor. Wed, 06 Dec 2023 14:10:52 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/TRIGA-International-to-produce-fuel-for-US-microre?feed=feed 1caf728b-aa8a-4f9d-b7ef-1e1c2e20ee08 Second APR-1400 at Shin Hanul starts upUnit 2 of the Shin Hanul nuclear power plant in South Korea has attained a sustained chain reaction for the first time, Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power announced. The unit is the second of two APR-1400 reactors at the site, with a further two planned. Wed, 06 Dec 2023 12:28:56 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Second-APR-1400-at-Shin-Hanul-starts-up?feed=feed 256a049c-1b94-411b-9328-1cbe6a6146dd In Pictures: Hinkley Point C polar crane installedThe 750-tonne polar crane has been lifted into place on the first reactor building at the Hinkley Point C nuclear power plant, which is being built in southwest England by EDF.
